windows.symptom: UEFI versus Legacy Boot        I just purchased a refurbished PC (that I an very happy with) but I would like to know how to have this PC use the Legacy Boot rather than the UEFI.  Is this a realistic possibility? I would like to multi-boot Windows 10 Pro with Ubuntu 18.04. It looks as if it is a simple matter of selecting the legacy section of the boot menu, but I would appreciate a response from someone who knows. and are there any issues with having to do other operations, additions or deletions?As always I very much appreciate any responses.Mike Bereece
solutions: Hi Mike. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Using Legacy instead of the modern UEFI interface is like buying a new car and disabling all of the safety features. You can do it if you want but just be aware of the risks which are that it's much less secure.To do so choose CSM or Legacy BIOS (or disable UEFI) and boot the media as a plain and not UEFI device. Delete all partitions down to Unallocated space to clear formatting, then click Next to let it auto-create and format the needed partitions and begin - this makes it foolproof. Follow the gold standard Clean Install in this link which compiles the best possible Install of Windows which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... To Dual boot with Ubuntu 18.04 see this guide: https://www.itzgeek.com/how-tos/linux/ubuntu-ho...I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

Good morning Greg:I very much appreciate your response which was educational to say the least.I was resigned to convert from UEFI to standard BIOS until i read your comment concerning the superiority of the EFI standard.Using the links you provided as well as others, I am trying to learn how to deal with doing what I want using the EFI standard. This appears to be a long and time consuming process, I should say that I am in my 70,s and not as sharp as I once was. However, I am retired, live alone and have little else to do.My current issue is that I want to have another copy of windows 10 Pro but in 32 Bit instead of 64 bit (I was a Lighting Designer when I worked and have some design software that will only run on a 32 bit platform). I had this multi-boot option on my old computer (and may still have it) but I cannot seem to get a 32 Bit Windows 10 installation to work (I got the 32 bit Windows 10 Pro version via the Media Creation Tool). I understand that the UEFI standard is not happy with 32 Bit. So....1.     Is this an impossible task to dual boot a 64 and 32 version of windows?2.     If not, can you provide some insight as to how this can be accomplished?If it matters, I have a TB C: drive;  a TB D: drive and a USB 2 TB drive. C: and D: have multiple partitions. the D: drive was previously on my old computer.You said I could contact you again so I am here.whatever assistance you can provide will be most appreciated.Mike Bereece

My name is David, an independent advisor and I am here to help you.We will start with the following process, please remove your printer and reinstall it, follow the steps below: unplug your printer from your PC and turn it off, go to control panel> hardware and sound> devices and printers. You could try to disable the service and see if any errors occur, there are some services that depend on it, but they may not be needed.To do this you can go to service.msc, find connected devices platform service, right click it and select disable.If everything seems to be fine after a while you can then go back, right click > properties > change the startup type to disabled.I disabled the service on my own computer for the last few minutes and have seen no negative impact yet.After disabling the startup type I would recommend restarting your computer and then seeing if there are any issues, or if the issue is gone.You can also see a little bit more information about this service here: http://servicedefaults.com/10/cdpsvc/Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. HiYou may try those methods to get it back. 1) Update Windows (As most of  the cases are related to incompatible or out of date drivers.)Go to Start > Settings > Update & Security > Windows Updates > Check for Windows UpdatesAfter getting updates, restart your computer.2) Get help from Windows built-in troubleshooterGo to Start > Settings > Update & Security > Troubleshoot > Hardware and Devices > Run the troubleshooter. Solved Android phone stuck on "obtaining ip address" while using mobile hotspot in windows 10        I wanted to use mobile hopspot utility of Windows 10 on my laptop to share LAN connected internet with my android mobile phone, but wifi connection with laptop stucked at "obtaining ip address". My laptop had internet connection, whereas I could not get internet on my mobile.I tried all the solutions suggested on the different threads, but problem was not solved.I am using Bitdefender Internet Security. I switched off the firewall of this internet security and my mobile connected and got internet immediately. My openion is, Microsoft and Bitdefender should find its better solution so that Switching OFF the firewall of Bitdefender is not required.
solutions: Hi, DKChauhan My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Try to follow these steps to repair your Internet connections: Enter the Start menu or by pressing the Win + I key combination, open the Settings and click on the Network and Internet option. Once there, we select the Status option from the menu on the left side and, within the configurations and options that are loaded in the right panel, we have to look for the restoration of the network. When you click on this option, it will show us a new window from where we can restore the network in Windows 10. In this way, all network adapters will be removed and reinstalled, and the original configuration of other network components will be restored. net. This implies that if we were using some software, such as a VPN client or virtual switches, we will have to reinstall them.A process that the system performs automatically by clicking on the Reset button that is now displayed in Network Reset in Windows 10 settings. It is normal for the process to not take long, although we must wait until the end completely and restart the computer to continue with the network configuration in Windows 10 as we have done so far.https://www.kapilarya.com/how-to-reset-network-...https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/10741/...You can also check that your drivers are updated. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402844...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

Hi DKChauhan,it's the manufacturer of your antivirus, Bitdefender, to find the solution to this problem and not Microsoft!They are the software and hardware manufacturers that need to adapt to Windows 10 and not the other way around.Windows 10 already has its native antivirus that works perfectly, there is no need to install third-party antivirus software that is not compatible with this operating system.

My intention is not to blame Microsoft/Windows or any antivirus, my intention was to help the people having the same problem, as it may be one of the reasons for such problem.Anyway, I have found a better solution for this problem (if antivirus is causing this problem).  ---1. Switch Mobile Hotspot ON; 2. Need to go to "Firewall Settings" of antivirus, then look for "default application behaviour", Click on "Edit default Rules", you will find 2 connections there - one WiFi and second "Local Area Connection* ## (some number)". Here you will find to choose one rule from three options of drop down menu - Automatic, Allow, Block; by default value for these connections is Automatic, this prevents from making network connections through windows; you need to select Allow for "Local Area Connection* ##" and thats all.3. Now there is no need to Switch OFF Firewall of third party antivirus.Hope, this will be helpful for other persons.
So Microsoft or Windows 10 has nothing to do if some installed third-party software isn't configured correctly.

windows.symptom: blue windows logo after updating from Windows 7 to 10        Hell everybody,Can somebody help me.Several times i tried to upgrade my laptop Samsung RV711 from windows 7 to 10.After restart the laptop it shows all the time the blue windows logo in a black screen and does nothing.I am open for any suggestions.More users have this problem as i looked the internet.Only not a solution i have.Thanks
solutions: You don't say if you paid for 10 or if you checked that your device's hardware was suitable to upgrade to 10.You may or may not still get 10 for free, but you first have to see if 10 is compatible with your device.The free upgrade to Windows 10 offer from Microsoft expired on the 29th July, 2016.You will have to contact MS support and they may be able to assist you with a free upgrade to 10..Also read this information:All the Ways You Can Still Upgrade to Windows 10 for FreeHere's how you can still get a free Windows 10 upgrade | ZDNet@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Upgrade to Windows 10: FAQ - Windows Help - Microsoft Support@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Windows 10 supported upgrade paths:✔ = Full upgrade is supported including personal data, settings, and applications.D = Edition downgrade; personal data is maintained, applications and settings are removed.https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/upgrade/windows-10-upgrade-paths@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@First thing to do is to make sure that you have the correct system requirements and that your Computer Manufacturer supplies the correct Drivers for 10 for your Model Number."Windows 10 System Requirements"https://www.thurrott.com/windows/windows-10/3884/windows-10-system-requirementshttps://www.microsoft.com/en-US/windows/windows-10-specifications#sysreqsIf you read those Microsoft's system requirements for 10, you will find that if you only go on them you will be sadly disappointed in performance.You should at least double what they say.@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Detailed information on Minimum hardware requirements:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/design/minimum/minimum-hardware-requirements-overview@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Some Manufacturers have listed Model Numberss tested with 10 at their website:Samsung - Find out if your system runs Windows 10.@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@If you do have to buy Windows 10:How to buy Windows 10:http://www.microsoftstore.com/store/msusa/en_US/cat/Windows/categoryID.70036700

It appears to be a problem with the Broadcom wifi. There are no Windows 10 drivers. See this:Microsoft forum thread.You have to open up the laptop and remove the wifi. Then replace it. Look for a how-to on Youtube.

windows.symptom: DVD Drive Problem:  Is it hardware or software?        I have a Dell Inspiron 3650 desktop.   When I insert a "new" DVD, then try to open it, I get message:"Windows cannot read the disk in drive D:\.   Make sure the disk uses a format the windows recognizes.  If the disk is unformatted, you need to format it before using it".I have tried 3 different types of CD/DVD media:  a HP CD-R, a Memorex DVD+R, and a Staples DVD+R.  Same problem with each one.  These are all "new" DVD's (have never been used before), so they should not need formatting.Also, when I open the DVD, there is not an option to format the DVD.  So how do I format it ?I have a "used" HP CD-R that contains some information I saved to it at one time (when I did not have this problem).  When I insert that CD, I can open it and look at the information on it without any problem.I checked to make sure the DVD driver is up to date.Any idea if this is a hardware problem, or a software problem ?  What should I try to fix it ?thank you
solutions: Hi,Just a guess, but it might be a problem with your AutoPlay setting for the drive..It may be recognizing the blank disk as something else..A new DVD does not need to be formatted.. That happens while files are being burned to it..There is a type of CD\DVD that can be formatted and have files added to it later, but that is not the way they are normally used..The only CD\DVD that routinely may need formatted would be the "RW" rewriteable type..

Hi rockydean I'll try to help you out. I think slance310 had a good point. A "blank" DVD is empty, and isn't "readable" by Windows.In order to "read" it, you have to burn some data on it. What happens when you try to burn some data on a CD / DVD ? I'll wait for your news Regards
you must check the  dvd writer hardware specifications, for  different  dvd writer  embeds  different  types of  dvd or  cd

My name is David an independent advisor and I am here to help you.For the incident you are presenting, I want you to verify the following configuration:Right-click on the sound icon on your taskbar> Select Sound> Go to the Recording tab> Right click on your recording device> Properties> Advanced options> Disable the options exclusively if they are enabled> select accept.Let me know the result of the process, if it has been useful or you still need more help, I will be waiting for your response.

Hi! Thank you for keeping in touch and informing me of the results of the process, do not worry, we will perform some other processes.As your incident continues, proceed to perform the following steps: 1. Right-click on the sound icon on your taskbar> Select Sound> Go to the Communications tab> select the “Do nothing” button and then click OK> Restart your PC.2. Update the drivers of your sound card: In the Windows search bar, type "device manager" and enter there> Open ‘Audio Inputs and Outputs’> right click on each of the devices you see> properties> driver tab> Click ‘Update Driver’> Click 'Search automatically for updated driver software'.> if a driver is installed restart your computer. 3. Create a restore point by following the steps in the following link https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402753... and install the Bluetooth Headset Helper driver, this can be downloaded from the following direct linkhttps://download.lenovo.com/ibmdl/pub/pc/pccbbs..., just run the installer. Thank you so much, TechGuy_82!I have spent more than 8 hours trying to update to Window 19 Version 1903, including doing what you suggested, without success. The error message I got was:0xc1900101 - 0xc4000D The installation failed in the SECOND_BOOT phase with an error during MIGRATE_DATA operation.

Hi Taylor,Let us check the Installation log to find why the update failed. Please share the logs as mentioned in this article. You should use a File sharing service like Onedrive or Media Fire to upload files and share link.https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/troubleshoot-feature-update-install-failures/eaf4ff24-64d6-4c72-824c-3ba3df716fc3The Panther logs. Files named Setupact.log and Setuperr.log from the following path C:\$Windows.~BT\Sources\PantherThe Rollback logs: These usually are created if Windows Update rolls back.  Files named Setupact.log and Setuperr.log from the following path C:\$Windows.~BT\Sources\Rollback[Only if the error code is 0xC1900101-0x30018] The Device Install Log from C:/$Windows.~bt\Sources\Rollback\setupapi\setupapi.dev.logAs the log size might be large consider zipping before uploading.
You can look at the Microsoft linked below.  Part way down the page it shows that exact error situation.https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/upgrade/resolution-procedures#0xc1900101

Hi againI am sorry to hear that this didn't helpThe Particular error that you've posted last can be addressed in most cases by working through the steps in the following help guidehttps://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...

Hi Taylor,Windows update logs aren't relevant in a feature update. Please share the Panther logs as described earlier.

Hi Sumit,Here are the Panther logs files, the Rollback logs files and the Setupapi logs files:https://www.dropbox.com/sh/5o425qwybnxf5hk/AAD4HgpLvEH3x8h2MM2RkOuKa?dl=0Thank you so much for your help!Taylor

Hi Taylor,The only device driver installation failed was of Synaptics Touchpad as I see. Description - Synaptics SMBus Drive     dvi:                     InfFile     - c:\windows\system32\driverstore\filerepository\synsmbdrv.inf_amd64_d3526af0e8f4a51f\synsmbdrv.inf     dvi:                     Section     - SynapticsInstallIntel     dvi:           {Select Best Driver - exit(0x00000000)}You can uninstall that temporarily and reinstall that after the update. However, there is a slight chance of Touchpad not working after the update. Remove the driver completely:https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_10-performance/uninstalling-a-driver-completely/8b7195cb-0d74-4ddf-ad55-ac0bcbf76f22Use the Media Creation tool to try updating.
